Class Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • Solver

  • class Solver
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes in the matrix from the already used Sudoku dataset, and uses a backtracking algorithm to solve it. It contains a constructor that sets the matrix to be used, and has a solving method aswell as brother methods. This toString method was adapted from a StackOverflow solution which I cannot find.
    Author:
    Austin FitzGerald

    • Constructor Detail

      • Solver

        public Solver(int[][] matrix)
        This constructor sets the matrix to be used, and calls the solving method.
        Parameters:
        matrix - This is the previously used matrix as defined in the main class.

    • Method Detail

      • solve

        private boolean solve(int row,
                      int col)
        This method contains the main backtracking code used to find the solution for the Sudoku stored in a 2d array. It runs through empty cells in order, fills them in randomly, and checks to see if the inputs are allowed. If they are not, then it does it again and again till it is legal. This is a type of depth-first searching. If you want to learn more about this bruteforcing method, check out https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudoku_solving_algorithms#Backtracking
        Parameters:
        row - The base value is 0, but the method changes it through each iteration
        col - Same as column, used for each search
        Returns:
        true when found allowed values (If they follow the basic Sudoku rules for numbering in rows/columns/boxes

      • isLegal

        private boolean isLegal(int row,
                        int col,
                        int val)
        This method checks if all values are legal, based on the basic Sudoku rules. It calls its brother methods to check for rows/columns and boxes.
        Parameters:
        row - The row to be checked
        col - The column to be checked
        val - The input value to be checked
        Returns:
        true if legal, false if not

      • contains

        private boolean contains(int row,
                         int col,
                         int val)
        This is a brother method to isLegal, it checks if a value is already used in the row or column.
        Parameters:
        row - The row to be checked
        col - The column to be checked
        val - The value to be checked in row and column
        Returns:
        true of already used, false if not

      • containsInBox

        private boolean containsInBox(int row,
                              int col,
                              int val)
        This is a brother method to isLegal, it checks if a value is already used in the 3x3 box.
        Parameters:
        row - The row in which the input is inside
        col - The column in which the input value is inside
        val - The value to be checked
        Returns:
        true if it is already used, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This toString method is adapted from a StackOverflow response. It outputs each matrix value into pretty rows and columns. I have made it look as much like a Sudoku grid as I can.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The String to be printed
